screen.title: Settings
screen.description: Manage organization setup, access control, and operational defaults.
screen.helpTooltip: Open setup guidance and recommended order.
screen.helpBody: Follow this order to avoid setup and permission conflicts.
screen.helpBodyForModule: Use this checklist to manage {{module}} clearly and safely.
screen.moduleDescription: Manage {{module}} setup, access, and operational defaults.
screen.descriptionForList: Review and manage {{module}} with aligned search, filters, table controls, and role-aware actions.
screen.descriptionForDetail: Review full {{moduleItem}} details and use only actions your role allows.
screen.descriptionForCreate: Provide required details to add a new {{moduleItem}} safely.
screen.descriptionForEdit: Update {{moduleItem}} details and save changes with clear validation.
screen.helpBodyForList: Use search, scoped filters, table settings, and pagination arrows to find records and open the right next action.
screen.helpBodyForDetail: Use this detail workflow to confirm record accuracy before editing or deleting.
screen.helpBodyForCreate: Use this create workflow to complete prerequisites, required fields, and save checks.
screen.helpBodyForEdit: Use this edit workflow to update only what is needed and confirm changes after saving.

helpList.sequence: Create tenant and facility context first, then structure modules like branches, departments, and units.
helpList.context: Choose readable names from lists; technical IDs stay hidden in standard workflows.
helpList.access: Role and permission modules control what users can see and do in every settings route.
helpList.moduleReview: Review current {{module}} records before making changes.
helpList.moduleActions: Use only actions that match your role for {{module}} workflows.
helpList.moduleAccess: If something is hidden or disabled in {{module}}, confirm your role permissions first.

list.review: Scan list rows first, then narrow results with Search field and Filter logic controls.
list.actions: Use table settings, row actions, and arrow navigation controls to move through records quickly.
list.access: Only actions allowed by your role appear; hidden or disabled controls require additional permission.
list.recovery: If data fails to load, use Retry and verify your network, tenant scope, and permissions.

detail.verify: Verify key fields and status before changing or deleting this record.
detail.actions: Use edit or delete only when allowed and when downstream modules are ready.
detail.access: If controls are disabled, your role is read-only for this record.
detail.recovery: Use back and retry options when data is stale or temporarily unavailable.

create.prerequisites: Confirm required parent context (tenant, facility, or role scope) before saving.
create.fields: Complete required fields and use readable names so teams can find records quickly.
create.submit: Submit once and wait for confirmation before leaving the screen.
create.recovery: If save fails, correct highlighted fields, retry, or return to list and try again.

edit.baseline: Review current values first so you only change what is necessary.
edit.changes: Apply minimal updates to avoid unexpected impact on connected workflows.
edit.submit: Save changes and verify the updated record details immediately.
edit.recovery: If update fails, retry after checking permissions, required fields, and network state.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.body: These terms govern access to and use of this platform across all countries and regions where it is made available, including web and mobile use for healthcare operations.

eligibility.title: 2. Eligibility
eligibility.body: You represent that you are legally permitted to use the service and, when acting for an organization, that you are authorized to bind that organization to these terms.

use.title: 3. Acceptable Use
use.body: You must use the platform only for lawful and legitimate purposes and may not misuse the service, attempt unauthorized access, interfere with operations, or upload harmful content.

healthcareCompliance.title: 4. Healthcare and Regulatory Compliance
healthcareCompliance.body: You are solely responsible for ensuring that your use of the platform complies with applicable healthcare, medical, and data regulations in your jurisdiction, including requirements on records, consent, and patient confidentiality.

privacy.title: 5. Privacy and Data Handling
privacy.body: You are responsible for lawful collection, entry, and use of personal and health-related data. You must provide required notices and obtain required legal bases or consent before processing data through the platform.

crossBorderData.title: 6. International and Cross-Border Data Transfers
crossBorderData.body: Because the platform may be used globally, your data may be processed in multiple regions. You are responsible for implementing any required transfer safeguards, contractual terms, and localization controls under local law.

account.title: 7. Account Responsibility and Security
account.body: You are responsible for account credentials, user permissions, and all activity performed under your workspace. You must promptly report suspected unauthorized access or security incidents.

feesBilling.title: 8. Fees, Billing, and Taxes
feesBilling.body: Paid features may require subscription fees. You agree to pay applicable charges and any required taxes under local law. Pricing, billing cycles, and plan terms are presented during plan selection and checkout.

intellectualProperty.title: 9. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.body: The platform, software, and related materials are protected by intellectual property laws. Except for rights expressly granted, no license or ownership is transferred to you.

serviceAvailability.title: 10. Service Availability and Updates
serviceAvailability.body: We may modify, improve, or suspend features to maintain security, reliability, and compliance. We do not guarantee uninterrupted availability in every jurisdiction or network environment.

liability.title: 11. Disclaimer and Limitation of Liability
liability.body: To the maximum extent permitted by law, the service is provided as-is and as-available. We are not responsible for indirect, incidental, or consequential losses, or for your regulatory non-compliance.

termination.title: 12. Suspension and Termination
termination.body: We may suspend or terminate access for violations of these terms, legal requirements, security concerns, or misuse. You may stop using the platform at any time, subject to applicable billing terms.

governingLaw.title: 13. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
governingLaw.body: These terms are interpreted under applicable contract and consumer laws. Where local law requires different protections or dispute rules, those mandatory local rights will prevail.

changes.title: 14. Changes to Terms
changes.body: We may update these terms to reflect legal, operational, or product changes. Continued use after an update takes effect constitutes acceptance of the revised terms, where permitted by law.

contact.title: 15. Contact and Legal Requests
contact.body: For support, legal notices, or compliance requests, contact the support channels listed in the application footer or your organization administrator.
